goals__remit: Open-Xchange is the world’s leading provider of open source software-as-a-service solutions for hosting, service provider and telecommunications companies advancing the trust and innovation of the Internet through valued customer engagement models.
relevant_communication:
Open-Xchange is a free software/open source company which adopts a user-centric business model based on openness, standards compliance, and privacy protection. The company routinely promotes these values and models and participates in Internet conferences, online discussions and public activities, including industry fairs, free software community gatherings, and policy forums. 
 
The TES project (tesmail.org) is a non-commercial endeavour promoted and sponsored by Open-Xchange to increase the security and privacy of email transport over the Internet. 
 
The ID4ME project (id4me.org) is an industry cooperation to provide an online identity and single sign-on platform in a privacy-friendly and user-centric way, allowing any company in Europe and elsewhere to provide Internet-scale credentials similarly to what the American OTTs are doing. 
 
The OX Summit is a double (European and US) yearly industry meeting where the future of the Internet and relevant policy issues are also discussed.
